news.title: Trump's approval rating on the economy drops to lowest of his presidential career, CNBC Survey finds
news.summary: President Donald Trump registering the worst economic approval numbers of his presidential career, according to the latest CNBC All-America Economic Survey. Trump's approval numbers are at the lowest level of his presidency.

news.title: White House claims letter to Harvard with demands was an 'unauthorized' mistake: NYT
news.summary: The April 11 letter set off a public feud between the White House and Harvard University. The letter was sent by President Obama to Harvard President Drew Faust. The White House said it was responding to a letter sent by the president of Harvard.

news.title: Top Wall Street analysts like these dividend-paying energy stocks
news.summary: TipRanks' analyst ranking service discusses three dividend-paying stocks. Energy Transfer and Diamondback Energy are two of them.

news.title: Trump administration announces fees on Chinese ships docking at U.S. ports
news.summary: The Trump administration on Thursday announced fees on Chinese-built vessels. The fees are expected to be in the region of $1,000 per vessel.

news.title: How long $2 million in retirement savings lasts in every U.S. state
news.summary: There's a nearly 50-year difference in how long $2 million lasts in retirement, depending on where you live. There’s a nearly50-year Difference in howLong $2m lasts in Retirement, Depending on Where You Live.

news.title: My IRA and personal trading account had the biggest one-day gain ever. What will tomorrow bring?
news.summary: “My personal trading account was also up 18% in one day,” he said. “Mypersonal trading account also was up 18%.”

news.title: ‘I ended up getting very sick’: I’m divorcing an abuser. I’ve had two terrible attorneys — and fired them both. Do I sue?
news.summary: “I want to focus on the monetary aspect, because money is tight and my divorce is not over yet,” she says.

news.title: Americans are ‘doom buying’ coffee, olive oil and soap. What’s the one thing I should stockpile to avoid tariff price hikes?
news.summary: Some purchases have echoes of the early days of the pandemic. Some purchases have Echoes of the Early Days of the Pandemic. There is a shortage of doctors and nurses in the U.S.

news.title: I begged my adviser to sell amid the market turmoil. He dragged his feet and I lost $20,000. Do I have any recourse?
news.summary: “If he had moved my money out of the market weeks ago, much of my loss could have been prevented,” she says.

news.title: ‘The whole thing feels predatory’: My grandma, 97, pays $170 a month for a $10,000 life-insurance policy. Should we stop payments?
news.summary: “After what quickly became a heated discussion, the agent advised me that canceling the policy would end any chance of a payout,” she said.
